org.sn.processpool

Interface ExecutorService


  • public interface ExecutorService
    An Executor that provides methods to manage termination and methods that can produce a Process Future for tracking progress of one or more asynchronous tasks in the process pool.

    An ExecutorService can be shut down, which will cause it to reject new tasks submitted to the process pool. The method provided for shutting down an ExecutorService is terminate(). The terminate() method will allow previously submitted tasks to execute before terminating or until the timeout period expires. The terminate() method also takes the parameter named isGraceful to mark if the immediate shutdown is required. If isGraceful flag is set to true, then the pool will kill all the running processes and terminate the pool. The ExecutorService is designed to as concurrent as possible and hence can be used to access the instance within multiple threads. 

      public class UsageExampleBasic{

        public static void main(String args[]) throws Exception{
                ExecutorService pool = ProcessPool.createProcessPool("UsageExamplePool", 2);
                ProcessFuture pf1 =pool.submit(TaskSuccess.class, args);
                ProcessFuture pf2 =pool.submit(TaskSuccess.class, args);
                ProcessFuture pf3 =pool.submit(TaskFailure.class, args);
                //the get method blocks the call to get the result
                TaskStatus ts1= pf1.get();
                Status status1 = ts1.getStatus();
                if(status1 == Status.SUCESS){
                        System.out.println("task1 completed Successfully");
                }
                
                TaskStatus ts2= pf2.get();
                Status status2 = ts2.getStatus();
                if(status2 == Status.SUCESS){
                        System.out.println("task2 completed Successfully");
                }
                
                TaskStatus ts3= pf3.get();
                Status status3 = ts3.getStatus();
                if(status3 == Status.FAILURE){
                        ts3.getException().printStackTrace();
                        System.out.println("task3 Failed");
                }
                
                //terminate the pool - pass true for graceful termination, the second parameter is minutes
                //wait for task completion
                pool.terminate(3000);
                
        }
    See Also:
    ProcessPool

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getPoolName()
      Returns the name of the pool.
      java.util.List<org.sn.processpool.ProcessHolder> getPoolStatistics()
      Returns the list of ProcessHolder objects with the details about each of the processes within the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        org.sn.processpool.ProcessFuture<org.sn.processpool.TaskStatus> submit(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                                     java.lang.String[] args)
        Submit the task to the pool to execute it asynchronously
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class that has main method as the entry point for execution.
        args - Arguments to the main class
        Returns:
        ProcessFuture - Returns the Output of the executed task.

      • terminate

        void terminate(long timeOutInMillis)
        Terminates the pool. Waits till the supplied timeout (timeOutInMillis) expires. setting the timeout to 0 will terminate all the processes abruptly. The currently running tasks will also be terminated without producing the required output.
        Parameters:
        timeOutInMillis - timeout in milliseconds

      • terminateNow

        void terminateNow()
        Terminates the pool abruptly. All the running tasks will be killed.

      • getPoolStatistics

        java.util.List<org.sn.processpool.ProcessHolder> getPoolStatistics()
        Returns the list of ProcessHolder objects with the details about each of the processes within the pool.
        Returns:
        the list of ProcessHolder

      • getPoolName

        java.lang.String getPoolName()
        Returns the name of the pool. This name is supplied at the time of the pool creation.
        Returns:
        Name of the Pool.
